heading: Content Block 1
summary: As of July 1, 2024, the support program dedicated to Ukrainians living in Romania has been changed.

heading: Content Block 2
summary: Monthly Lump Sum for AccommodationBeneficiaries of temporary protection in Romania may be eligible for a monthly lump sum to cover accommodation expenses for up to 3 consecutive months, beginning July 1, 2024, as outlined inGovernment Emergency Ordinance No. 96/2024. The 3-month period starts from the date of entry into Romania. This financial support aims to assist refugees with accommodation during their transition into the country.ExclusionsThe lump sum payment does not apply to:Beneficiaries receiving international protection.Individuals residing in temporary accommodation camps provided by the government.Beneficiaries who have previously received accommodation benefits under previous regulations are not eligible for these additional months of support.AmountThe payment is:750 RON per monthfor a single individual.2,000 RON per monthfor families.Special CasesUnderArticle 26of theGovernment Emergency Ordinance No. 96/2024, there are provisions for beneficiaries in more stabilized living situations, such as those receiving additional government support or housed in temporary accommodation camps. In these cases, the financial assistance is:500 RON per monthfor individuals.1,500 RON per monthfor families.These amounts are lower than the standard lump sum, reflecting the reduced need for financial support due to the provision of government resources such as housing and basic services.Required DocumentsTo apply for the lump sum, beneficiaries must submit:Valid temporary protection permit.Passports for each family member.Bank account details (the account must be opened in a Romanian bank, in RON currency).Any other documents requested by the local authorities.Application ProcessBeneficiaries need to submit their application to the local administrative-territorial unit (such as the town hall) where they have chosen to reside. The following steps must be followed:Fill in the application form (e.g., "Anexa 1").Provide personal details, including the CNP numbers (from the temporary protection permits) for each family member.Attach proof of temporary protection for all family members.Provide a bank account statement with the applicant’s name.Indicate that the applicant is not residing in a temporary accommodation camp.NotesThe application for the first month's payment should be submitted within the first 5 working days of the first month.Local authorities will check the application within 3 working days to ensure eligibility.Exclusions for Rent Payment SupportYou cannot benefit from the accommodation support program if:You are a Romanian citizen.You reside in a university dormitory as a student.You have a work permit or student residence permit in Romania.

heading: Content Block 3
summary: Transition to Minimum Inclusion IncomeAfter the period during which beneficiaries receive the lump sum specified above has ended, as well as for those who previously received benefits, they may apply for a Minimum Inclusion Income. This ongoing financial support is provided in accordance with the provisions of Law No. 196/2016 regarding minimum inclusion income, with its subsequent amendments and additions.Application Process and Required Documents:Documents on the minimum inclusive income should be submitted to the administrative-territorial unit within the radius of which the address indicated in the temporary residence permit is located.

heading: Content Block 6
summary: Social benefits for refugees from UkraineRefugees from Ukraine under temporary protection in Romania are eligible for social benefits. Learn more about the available types of support and the necessary steps for submitting the required paperwork.Learn more

heading: Content Block 7
summary: If you are a Ukrainian/foreign citizen receiving temporary protection and you are experiencing difficulties in submitting your application:Ask for the help of Romanian / English speakers near you to translate your problem to the representative of the town hall.If you have problems, get in touch with an NGO that has Ukrainian-Russian-Romanian speakers.If you have problems, contact a call center that has Ukrainian-Russian-Romanian speakers.For additional details, you can call021.3456789 – government call centerbetween 08:00 and 16:00.UNHCR Romania: +40 723 653 651CNRR: +40 730 073 170

heading: Content Block 8
summary: Assistance in finding housingIf you need help finding free accommodation, use the platformUn Acoperiș(A Roof):The central authorities, together with international organizations, will centrally coordinate requests for assistance and all available accommodation, and will provide you with accommodation according to your needs.Access the platform
